# Really Senseless Admins

## Challenge
* Category: Cryptography
* Points: 35

We fired Julius, but the new guy apparently misplaced the file with our pivate key. All he could find was the encrypted flag and some file labeled 'params'. [flag.enc]('https://challenge.acictf.com/static/e4eae124c130f0359e036f93aab26a78/flag.enc') [params.txt]('https://challenge.acictf.com/static/e4eae124c130f0359e036f93aab26a78/params.txt')

### Hints
* The new guy apparently just treated the flag text as a big-endian integer. Apparently, this made it easier for him to use the online tools he had found.
* Wouldn't it be nice if there were detailed write-ups about these cryptosystems?
* We found a few notes on the admin's desk. One note just had the URL of an online RSA tool. The second note had two URLs on it with 'plaintext ⇒ hex ⇒ int' scribbled beside it. The third one makes it look like the plaintext generated by the RSA tool will start with 104.

## Solution

Ok. Go to [this page]('https://www.cryptool.org/en/cto-highlights/rsa-step-by-step') and enter the following:

```
p = 
q = 
e = 82673630939154540737332448962792509162965479788901382135850578191063941371117

ciphertext =

```

This will produce the following plaintext:
```
104873340459054924181115292546315913092671367560727053916844669
```

We'll do 2 conversions:
* INT -> HEX
* HEX -> ASCII

### INT -> HEX
https://www.rapidtables.com/convert/number/decimal-to-hex.html

Put `104873340459054924181115292546315913092671367560727053916844669` in the Decimal box

Which produces: `4143497B5072316D33735F54214D337A5F63383966666266327D`


### HEX -> ASCII
https://www.rapidtables.com/convert/number/hex-to-ascii.html

PUT `4143497B5072316D33735F54214D337A5F63383966666266327D` in the Hex box

Which produces: **ACI{Pr1m3s_T!M3z_c89ffbf2}**
